bioghist.p: Alfred and Florence Borgnis of New Castle, Delaware, started traveling in 1952 after ten years of marriage and two children. Alfred Borgnis was an auto mechanic and his wife Florence was a homemaker and school teacher. They pulled a 31-foot house-trailer from New Castle to Yuma, Arizona. They lived in Yuma for six months and in Los Angeles for three months before pulling their trailer over the Rocky Mountains and returning home to New Castle a year later. On that trip they visited the Grand Canyon, Disneyland, and many other sites in the West. In 1968, they took their first overseas trip, to Italy. In the following years, they visited every state and most of the countries of Europe. They also visited China, Australia, Columbia, Egypt, Greece, Turkey, Israel, the Soviet Union, the Caribbean Islands, Mexico, and the Panama Canal.

scopecontent.p: The Florence and Alfred Borgnis travel collection consists of 13 boxes containing travel diaries and approximately 10,000 slides. These materials were created from 1967 to 1991 during their varied travels.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
